meanings.definition: A style of jazz singing in which the voice is used in imitation of an instrument.
meanings.sent1: The singer's vocalese sounded like a trumpet solo.
meanings.sent2: She performed vocalese at the jazz club last night.
meanings.sent3: The vocalese artist sang a saxophone tune with her voice.
meanings.sent4: His vocalese was so convincing, it felt like the piano was singing.
meanings.sent5: The vocalese performance painted a musical picture in the audience's minds.

meanings.definition: The technique of setting lyrics to an instrumental jazz solo.
meanings.sent1: The vocalese added meaningful words to the saxophone melody.
meanings.sent2: They wrote beautiful lyrics for the vocalese of the trumpet solo.
meanings.sent3: In the vocalese, the singer turned the saxophone solo into a story.
meanings.sent4: Her vocalese transformed the instrumental jazz solo into a lyrical masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The vocalese lyrics brought a new dimension to the instrumental jazz piece.
